Uses of Interface
javaslang.control.Option

  • Packages that use Option 
    Package Description
    javaslang.collection
    Immutable collections based on Traversable like the linked list List and the lazy linked list Stream.
    javaslang.control
    Control structures like Match, the disjoint union type Either, the optional value type Option and Try for exception handling.
    javaslang.test
    A property check framework built around Property which integrates well with unit test frameworks like junit.

    • Uses of Option in javaslang.collection

      Methods in javaslang.collection that return Option 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default Option<Double> Traversable.average()
      Calculates the average of this elements.
      default Option<T> Traversable.findFirst(Predicate<? super T> predicate)
      Returns the first element of this which satisfies the given predicate.
      default Option<T> Traversable.findLast(Predicate<? super T> predicate)
      Returns the last element of this which satisfies the given predicate.
      Option<T> List.Cons.headOption() 
      Option<T> List.Nil.headOption() 
      Option<T> Stream.Cons.headOption() 
      Option<T> Stream.Nil.headOption() 
      Option<T> Traversable.headOption()
      Returns the first element of a non-empty Traversable as Option.
      default Option<List<T>> List.initOption() 
      Option<? extends Seq<T>> Seq.initOption() 
      default Option<Stream<T>> Stream.initOption() 
      Option<? extends Traversable<T>> Traversable.initOption()
      Dual of Traversable.tailOption(), returning all elements except the last as Option.
      default Option<T> Traversable.lastOption()
      Dual of Traversable.headOption(), returning the last element as Opiton.
      default Option<T> Traversable.max()
      Calculates the maximum of this elements according to their natural order.
      default Option<T> Traversable.maxBy(Comparator<? super T> comparator)
      Calculates the maximum of this elements using a specific comparator.
      default Option<T> Traversable.min()
      Calculates the minimum of this elements according to their natural order.
      default Option<T> Traversable.minBy(Comparator<? super T> comparator)
      Calculates the minimum of this elements using a specific comparator.
      Option<List<T>> List.Cons.tailOption() 
      Option<List<T>> List.Nil.tailOption() 
      Option<? extends Seq<T>> Seq.tailOption() 
      Option<Stream<T>> Stream.Cons.tailOption() 
      Option<Stream<T>> Stream.Nil.tailOption() 
      Option<? extends Traversable<T>> Traversable.tailOption()
      Drops the first element of a non-empty Traversable and returns an Option.

    • Uses of Option in javaslang.control

      Classes in javaslang.control that implement Option 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  None<T>
      None is a singleton representation of the undefined Option.
      class  Some<T>
      Some represents a defined Option.
      Methods in javaslang.control that return Option 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default Option<T> Option.filter(Predicate<? super T> predicate)
      Returns Some(value) if this is a Some and the value satisfies the given predicate.
      default <U> Option<U> Option.flatMap(Function<? super T,? extends Option<U>> mapper)
      Maps the value to a new Option if this is a Some, otherwise returns None.
      default <U> Option<U> Option.flatten(Function<? super T,? extends Option<U>> f)
      Flattens an Option using a function.
      <U> Option<U> Option.map(Function<? super T,? extends U> mapper)
      Maps the value and wraps it in a new Some if this is a Some, returns None.
      static <T> Option<T> Option.of(T value)
      Creates a new Option of a given value.
      Option<T> Option.peek(Consumer<? super T> action)
      Applies an action to this value, if this option is defined, otherwise does nothing.
      Option<L> Either.LeftProjection.toOption()
      Converts this Either to an Option.
      Option<R> Either.RightProjection.toOption()
      Converts this Either to an Option.
      Option<T> Try.toOption() 
      Methods in javaslang.control that return types with arguments of type Option 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Either.LeftProjection<Option<L>,Option<R>> Either.LeftProjection.filter(Predicate<? super L> predicate)
      Returns LeftProjection(Left(Some(value))), if the underlying Either of this projection is a Left and the left value satisfies the given predicate LeftProjection(Left(None))) if the underlying Either of this projection is a Left and the left value does not satisfy the given predicate LeftProjection(Right(Some(value))) otherwise, i.e.
      Either.LeftProjection<Option<L>,Option<R>> Either.LeftProjection.filter(Predicate<? super L> predicate)
      Returns LeftProjection(Left(Some(value))), if the underlying Either of this projection is a Left and the left value satisfies the given predicate LeftProjection(Left(None))) if the underlying Either of this projection is a Left and the left value does not satisfy the given predicate LeftProjection(Right(Some(value))) otherwise, i.e.
      Either.RightProjection<Option<L>,Option<R>> Either.RightProjection.filter(Predicate<? super R> predicate)
      Returns RightProjection(Right(Some(value))), if the underlying Either of this projection is a Right and the right value satisfies the given predicate RightProjection(Right(None))) if the underlying Either of this projection is a Right and the right value does not satisfy the given predicate RightProjection(Left(Some(value))) otherwise, i.e.
      Either.RightProjection<Option<L>,Option<R>> Either.RightProjection.filter(Predicate<? super R> predicate)
      Returns RightProjection(Right(Some(value))), if the underlying Either of this projection is a Right and the right value satisfies the given predicate RightProjection(Right(None))) if the underlying Either of this projection is a Right and the right value does not satisfy the given predicate RightProjection(Left(Some(value))) otherwise, i.e.
      Method parameters in javaslang.control with type arguments of type Option 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default <U> Option<U> Option.flatMap(Function<? super T,? extends Option<U>> mapper)
      Maps the value to a new Option if this is a Some, otherwise returns None.
      default <U> Option<U> Option.flatten(Function<? super T,? extends Option<U>> f)
      Flattens an Option using a function.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      An optional error.

      An optional sample which falsified the property or which lead to an error.
